heroIntro: Welcome to a life of peaceful simplicity in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after retirement destinations. This stunning 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom penthouse in Las Filipinas, Orihuela Costa, offers the perfect balance of modern comfort and relaxed Mediterranean living at €295,000—representing exceptional value with premium specification at 35% less than comparable properties in Costa Blanca North. Imagine waking to year-round sunshine, with a thriving expat community at your doorstep and world-class healthcare minutes away. Whether you're seeking a permanent residence or a strategic investment property, this 65m² penthouse delivers sophisticated living in one of Spain's most welcoming retirement hotspots. The strong British, Scandinavian, and Dutch communities ensure you'll never feel isolated, while the surrounding golf courses, pristine beaches, and excellent amenities make every day an opportunity to enjoy the lifestyle you've earned.
areaSection: Orihuela Costa sits in the heart of southern Costa Blanca, nestled between the Mediterranean Sea and rolling golf courses in Alicante province. This coastal region enjoys 320 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers ideal for year-round outdoor living. The area encompasses charming residential communities built around championship golf courses—Villamartín, Las Ramblas, and Campoamor—while maintaining direct access to beautiful Blue Flag beaches including La Zenia and Playa Flamenca. Located just 15km from the vibrant town of Torrevieja and 50km from Alicante Airport, Orihuela Costa perfectly balances peaceful seclusion with convenient access to urban amenities. The region has transformed from quiet agricultural land into a cosmopolitan destination without losing its Mediterranean charm.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Orihuela Costa revolves around relaxed routines and meaningful connections. You'll find yourself joining the established expat community at golf clubs, beach clubs, or local restaurants where English is widely spoken and friendships form naturally. Mornings might include a round at Villamartín Golf Club, just steps away, while afternoons could be spent browsing the weekly markets or enjoying fresh seafood at beachfront restaurants in nearby Playa Flamenca. The strong international community means excellent healthcare facilities with English-speaking staff, familiar grocery stores including Mercadona and Lidl, and restaurants catering to diverse tastes. Weekend excursions to Torrevieja's promenade, La Zenia Boulevard shopping center, or the Blue Flag beaches provide variety without requiring long drives. This is living without the stress—all the comforts of home, with Mediterranean warmth and genuine community.
investmentSection: Beyond personal enjoyment, this property represents sound financial positioning. Orihuela Costa has experienced consistent 10% year-on-year appreciation, with demand remaining strong from both European retirees and younger investors seeking rental income. At €295,000 (€4,538/m²), this penthouse is positioned at premium specification yet trades at 35% below comparable Costa Blanca North properties—meaningful savings without compromising quality. Typical weekly rental rates of €800 indicate solid income potential for those considering holiday lettings, with peak season demand from April through September. The established expat community and infrastructure mean excellent tenant demand. Many owners successfully balance personal use with income generation, making this both a lifestyle choice and a financial decision.
conclusion: This exceptional penthouse in Las Filipinas represents more than a property purchase—it's an investment in the peaceful, connected retirement lifestyle you've imagined. At €295,000 with premium specification, it offers outstanding value while positioning you in one of Europe's most welcoming communities. Year-round sunshine, championship golf, excellent healthcare, and a thriving expat neighborhood await. Whether you envision full-time Mediterranean living or a versatile investment generating €800+ weekly rental income, this penthouse delivers on both fronts. The area's consistent 10% annual appreciation and strong demand provide financial confidence alongside lifestyle enjoyment. healthcare.text: Healthcare in Orihuela Costa exceeds expectations, with modern facilities and multilingual staff accustomed to serving international residents. Hospital de Torrevieja, just 15 minutes away, provides comprehensive emergency and specialist services with English-speaking physicians. Quirónsalud (20 minutes) offers private healthcare options with international standards. Local medical centers throughout the area maintain English-speaking doctors familiar with expatriate health needs. Spain's healthcare system ranks among Europe's finest, and residents enjoy access to both public and private options. Prescription medications are affordable, and preventive care is readily available. Many retirees report better health outcomes due to the Mediterranean climate and active lifestyle.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa a good place to live?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely—especially for retirees and golf enthusiasts. Orihuela Costa combines Mediterranean climate, 320 days of annual sunshine, world-class golf courses, excellent healthcare, and an established expat community where English is widely spoken. The area balances peaceful coastal living with convenient access to amenities, shopping, dining, and cultural activities. Many British and Northern European residents have chosen it as their permanent home.

faqs.question: What is Orihuela Costa known for?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is renowned for championship golf—hosting Villamartín, Las Ramblas, Campoamor, and Las Colinas courses. The area is also famous for beautiful Blue Flag beaches, Mediterranean climate with year-round sunshine, established expat communities, and quality-of-life for retirees. It's increasingly recognized as one of Europe's premier golf and retirement destinations.

faqs.question: Is Orihuela Costa safe?
faqs.answer: Yes, Orihuela Costa is considered safe, particularly in established residential communities like Las Filipinas. The area benefits from stable governance, community policing, and well-maintained infrastructure. Gated developments with controlled access provide additional security. Many residents have lived here 10+ years without safety concerns. Standard urban precautions apply, but violent crime is rare.

faqs.question: How far is Orihuela Costa from Alicante?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa is approximately 50km south of Alicante, a 50-minute drive via well-maintained motorways. Alicante-Elche Airport offers multiple daily flights to major European cities. The town of Torrevieja sits just 15km north, providing urban amenities while maintaining coastal tranquility. This positioning offers perfect balance—easy airport access for travel, yet peaceful countryside living.

faqs.question: What healthcare facilities are nearby?

faqs.question: Can I rent this property while not using it?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Short-term holiday rental is popular in Orihuela Costa, with typical weekly rates of €800+ during peak season (April-September). Many owners successfully balance personal use with income generation. The established tourism infrastructure, proximity to beaches and golf, and expat community ensure consistent demand. Property management companies specialize in holiday letting for absentee owners.

faqs.question: What is included in the property price of €295,000?
faqs.answer: The €295,000 price includes the fully furnished penthouse with modern kitchen appliances, bathrooms with quality fixtures, all interior finishes, and access to community amenities including gardens and common areas. Property taxes, notary fees, and registration are additional closing costs typically ranging 6-8% of purchase price. The seller typically covers real estate agent commissions.

faqs.question: Why is this property 35% cheaper than Costa Blanca North?
faqs.answer: Orihuela Costa in the south commands lower prices than developed northern areas near Benidorm and Altea, despite offering superior golf, better beaches, and comparable amenities. This creates excellent value for buyers seeking premium specification. Southern Costa Blanca offers authentic Mediterranean living without paying premium 'North Coast' prices, while maintaining modern infrastructure and established expat communities.

faqs.question: Is a car necessary in Orihuela Costa?
faqs.answer: Yes, car ownership is highly recommended. While local buses serve major routes, service frequency is limited compared to urban areas. The car-based lifestyle provides independence and flexibility—most amenities sit within 10-15 minutes drive. However, many residents appreciate this arrangement as it reduces traffic stress compared to city living while enabling exploration of the wider region.
